options.description:

See aerc-config(5).</para>

options.description:

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.extraBinds

options.description:
<para>Extra config specific to this account, added to
<filename>$HOME/.config/aerc/aerc.conf</filename>.
See <citerefentry><refentrytitle>aerc-config</refentrytitle><manvolnum>5</manvolnum></citerefentry>.</para>
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string of float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.extraConfig

options.description:
<para>Sets the authentication mechanism if imap is used as the incoming
method.
See <citerefentry><refentrytitle>aerc-imap</refentrytitle><manvolnum>5</manvolnum></citerefentry>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.imapAuth

options.description:
<para>Sets the oauth2 params if authentication mechanism oauthbearer or
xoauth2 is used.
See <citerefentry><refentrytitle>aerc-imap</refentrytitle><manvolnum>5</manvolnum></citerefentry>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.imapOauth2Params

options.description:
<para>Sets the authentication mechanism if smtp is used as the outgoing
method.
See <citerefentry><refentrytitle>aerc-smtp</refentrytitle><manvolnum>5</manvolnum></citerefentry>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpAuth

options.description:
<para>Sets the oauth2 params if authentication mechanism oauthbearer or
xoauth2 is used.
See <citerefentry><refentrytitle>aerc-imap</refentrytitle><manvolnum>5</manvolnum></citerefentry>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpOauth2Params

options.description: <para>Alternative email addresses of this account.</para>
options.type: list of string matching the pattern .*@.*
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aliases

options.description:
<para>Contact completion configuration as expected per alot.
See <link xlink:href="http://alot.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration/contacts_completion.html">alot's wiki</link> for
explanation about possible values.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.alot.contactCompletion

options.description: <para>Extra settings to add to this Alot account configuration.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.alot.extraConfig

options.description:
<para>Command to send a mail. If msmtp is enabled for the account,
then this is set to
<command>msmtpq --read-envelope-from --read-recipients</command>.</para>

options.description: <para>Whether to enable Astroid.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.enable

options.description: <para>Extra settings to add to this astroid account configuration.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.extraConfig

options.description:
<para>Command to send a mail. If msmtp is enabled for the account,
then this is set to
<command>msmtpq --read-envelope-from --read-recipients</command>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.sendMailCommand

options.description:
<para>Some email providers have peculiar behavior that require
special treatment. This option is therefore intended to
indicate the nature of the provider.
</para><para>
When this indicates a specific provider then, for example,
the IMAP, SMTP, and JMAP server configuration may be set
automatically.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.flavor

options.description: <para>Standard email folders.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders

options.description: <para>Relative path of the drafts mail folder.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.drafts

options.description: <para>Relative path of the inbox mail.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.inbox

options.description: <para>Relative path of the sent mail folder.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.sent

options.description: <para>Relative path of the deleted mail folder.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.trash

options.description: <para>Whether to enable the getmail mail retriever for this account.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.enable

options.description:
<para>Enable if you want to delete read messages from the server. Most
users should either enable <literal>delete</literal> or disable
<literal>readAll</literal>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.delete

options.description: <para>Specify a command delivering the incoming mail to your maildir.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.destinationCommand

options.description:
<para>A non-empty list of mailboxes. To download all mail you can
use the <literal>ALL</literal> mailbox.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.mailboxes

options.description:
<para>Enable if you want to fetch all, even the read messages from the
server. Most users should either enable <literal>delete</literal> or
disable <literal>readAll</literal>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.readAll

options.description: <para>GPG configuration.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg

options.description: <para>Encrypt outgoing messages by default.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.encryptByDefault

options.description: <para>The key to use as listed in <command>gpg --list-keys</command>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.key

options.description: <para>Sign messages by default.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.signByDefault

options.description: <para>Whether to enable Enable Himalaya for this email account..</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.himalaya.enable

options.description:
<para>Specifying 'accounts.email.accounts.*.himalaya.backend' is deprecated,
set 'accounts.email.accounts.*.himalaya.settings.backend' instead.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.himalaya.backend

options.description:
<para>Specifying 'accounts.email.accounts.*.himalaya.sender' is deprecated,
set 'accounts.email.accounts.*.himalaya.settings.sender' instead.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.himalaya.sender

options.description:
<para>Himalaya configuration for this email account.
See <link xlink:href="https://pimalaya.org/himalaya/cli/configuration/account.html"/> for supported values.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.himalaya.settings

options.description: <para>The IMAP configuration to use for this account.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap

options.description: <para>Hostname of IMAP server.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.host

options.description:
<para>The port on which the IMAP server listens. If
<literal>null</literal> then the default port is used.</para>
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.port

options.description: <para>Configuration for secure connections.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls

options.description: <para>Whether to enable TLS/SSL.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.enable

options.description:
<para>Path to file containing certificate authorities that should
be used to validate the connection authenticity. If
<literal>null</literal> then the system default is used.
Note, if set then the system default may still be accepted.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.certificatesFile

options.description: <para>Whether to use STARTTLS.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.useStartTls

options.description: <para>Whether to enable imapnotify.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.enable

options.description: <para>IMAP folders to watch.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.boxes

options.description: <para>Additional configuration to add for this account.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.extraConfig

options.description: <para>Shell commands to run on any event.</para>
options.type: string or attribute set of string
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.onNotify

options.description: <para>Shell commands to run after onNotify event.</para>
options.type: string or attribute set of string
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.onNotifyPost

options.description: <para>The JMAP configuration to use for this account.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap

options.description: Hostname of JMAP server. If both this option and are specified, host is preferred by applications when establishing a session.
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap.host

options.description: URL for the JMAP Session resource. If both this option and are specified, host is preferred by applications when establishing a session.
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap.sessionUrl

options.description: <para>Whether to enable lieer Gmail synchronization for notmuch.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.enable

options.description:
<para>Warn if Notmuch is not also enabled for this account.
</para><para>
This can safely be disabled if <command>notmuch init</command>
has been used to configure this account outside of Home
Manager.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.notmuchSetupWarning

options.description:
<para>Settings which are applied to <filename>.gmailieer.json</filename>
for the account.
</para><para>
See the <link xlink:href="https://github.com/gauteh/lieer/">lieer manual</link>
for documentation of settings not explicitly covered by this module.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings

options.description: <para>Allow missing labels on the Gmail side to be dropped.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.drop_non_existing_label

options.description:
<para>Extension to include in local file names, which can be useful
for indexing with third-party programs.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.file_extension

options.description:
<para>Work around a Gmail API quirk where an empty change history
is sometimes returned.
</para><para>
See this
<link xlink:href="https://github.com/gauteh/lieer/issues/120">GitHub issue</link>
for more details.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_empty_history

options.description:
<para>Set Gmail labels to ignore when syncing from remote labels to
local tags (before translations).</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_remote_labels

options.description:
<para>Set labels to ignore when syncing from local tags to
remote labels (after translations).</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_tags

options.description: <para>Local tag to which the remote Gmail 'TRASH' label is translated.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.local_trash_tag

options.description: <para>Remove local messages that have been deleted on the remote.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.remove_local_messages

options.description: <para>Replace '/' with '.' in Gmail labels.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.replace_slash_with_dot

options.description: <para>HTTP timeout in seconds. 0 means forever or system timeout.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.timeout

options.description: <para>Whether to enable lieer synchronization service.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.sync.enable

options.description:
<para>How often to synchronize the account.
</para><para>
This value is passed to the systemd timer configuration as the
onCalendar option. See
<citerefentry>
  <refentrytitle>systemd.time</refentrytitle>
  <manvolnum>7</manvolnum>
</citerefentry>
for more information about the format.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.sync.frequency

options.description: <para>Maildir configuration for this account.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.maildir

options.description:
<para>Path to maildir directory where mail for this account is
stored. This is relative to the base maildir path.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.maildir.path

options.description: <para>Whether to enable synchronization using mbsync.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.enable

options.description:
<para>Automatically create missing mailboxes within the
given mail store.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.create

options.description:
<para>Permanently remove messages marked for deletion from
the given mail store.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.expunge

options.description: <para>Account section extra configuration.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.account

options.description: <para>Per channel extra configuration.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.channel

options.description: <para>Local store extra configuration.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.local

options.description: <para>Remote store extra configuration.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.remote

options.description:
<para>If set, flattens the hierarchy within the maildir by
substituting the canonical hierarchy delimiter
<literal>/</literal> with this value.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.flatten

options.description:
<para>Some email providers (Gmail) have a different directory hierarchy for
synchronized email messages. Namely, when using mbsync without specifying
a set of channels into a group, all synchronized directories end up beneath
the <literal>[Gmail]/</literal> directory.
</para><para>
This option allows you to specify a group, and subsequently channels that
will allow you to sync your mail into an arbitrary hierarchy.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups

options.description:
<para>List of channels that should be grouped together into this group. When
performing a synchronization, the groups are synchronized, rather than
the individual channels.
</para><para>
Using these channels and then grouping them together allows for you to
define the maildir hierarchy as you see fit.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels

options.description:
<para>Extra configuration lines to add to <emphasis>THIS</emphasis> channel's
configuration.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.extraConfig

options.description:
<para>IMAP4 patterns for which mailboxes on the remote mail server to sync.
If <literal>Patterns</literal> are specified, <literal>farPattern</literal>
is interpreted as a prefix which is not matched against the patterns,
and is not affected by mailbox list overrides.
</para><para>
If this is left as the default, then mbsync will default to the pattern
<literal>INBOX</literal>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.farPattern

options.description:
<para>The unique name for THIS channel in THIS group. The group will refer to
this channel by this name.
</para><para>
In addition, you can manually sync just this channel by specifying this
name to mbsync on the command line.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.name

options.description:
<para>Name for where mail coming from the remote (far) mail server will end up
locally. The mailbox specified by the far pattern will be placed in
this directory.
</para><para>
If this is left as the default, then mbsync will default to the pattern
<literal>INBOX</literal>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.nearPattern

options.description:
<para>Instead of synchronizing <emphasis>just</emphasis> the mailboxes that
match the <literal>farPattern</literal>, use it as a prefix which is
not matched against the patterns, and is not affected by mailbox list
overrides.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.patterns

options.description:
<para>The name of this group for this account. These names are different than
some others, because they will hide channel names that are the same.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.name

options.description: <para>Pattern of mailboxes to synchronize.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.patterns

options.description: <para>Propagate mailbox deletions to the given mail store.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.remove

options.description:
<para>The on-disk folder naming style. This option has no
effect when <option>flatten</option> is used.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.subFolders

options.description:
<para>Whether to enable msmtp.
</para><para>
If enabled then it is possible to use the
<parameter class="command">--account</parameter> command line
option to send a message for a given account using the
<command>msmtp</command> or <command>msmtpq</command> tool.
For example, <command>msmtp --account=private</command> would
send using the account defined in
<option>accounts.email.accounts.private</option>. If the
<parameter class="command">--account</parameter> option is not
given then the primary account will be used.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.enable

options.description:
<para>Extra configuration options to add to <filename>~/.msmtprc</filename>.
See <link xlink:href="https://marlam.de/msmtp/msmtprc.txt"/> for
examples.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.extraConfig

options.description:
<para>Fingerprint of a trusted TLS certificate.
The fingerprint can be obtained by executing
<command>msmtp --serverinfo --tls --tls-certcheck=off</command>.</para>
options.type: null or string matching the pattern ([[:alnum:]]{2}:)+[[:alnum:]]{2}
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.tls.fingerprint

options.description: <para>Whether to enable mu indexing.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mu.enable

options.description: <para>Whether to enable mujmap JMAP synchronization for notmuch.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.enable

options.description:
<para>Warn if Notmuch is not also enabled for this account.
</para><para>
This can safely be disabled if <filename>mujmap.toml</filename> is managed
outside of Home Manager.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.notmuchSetupWarning

options.description:
<para>Settings which are applied to <filename>mujmap.toml</filename>
for the account.
</para><para>
See the <link xlink:href="https://github.com/elizagamedev/mujmap">mujmap project</link>
for documentation of settings not explicitly covered by this module.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings

options.description:
<para>Whether to create new mailboxes automatically on the server from notmuch
tags.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.auto_create_new_mailboxes

options.description:
<para>The cache directory in which to store mail files while they are being
downloaded. The default is operating-system specific.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.cache_dir

options.description:
<para>Fully qualified domain name of the JMAP service.
</para><para>
mujmap looks up the JMAP SRV record for this host to determine the JMAP session
URL. Mutually exclusive with
<xref linkend="opt-accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.session_url"/>.
</para><para>
If <literal>null</literal>, defaults to
<xref linkend="opt-accounts.email.accounts._name_.jmap.host"/>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.fqdn

options.description:
<para>Shell command which will print a password to stdout for basic HTTP
authentication.
</para><para>
If <literal>null</literal>, defaults to
<xref linkend="opt-accounts.email.accounts._name_.passwordCommand"/>.</para>
options.type: null or string or list of string
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.password_command

options.description:
<para>Session URL to connect to.
</para><para>
Mutually exclusive with
<xref linkend="opt-accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.fqdn"/>.
</para><para>
If <literal>null</literal>, defaults to
<xref linkend="opt-accounts.email.accounts._name_.jmap.sessionUrl"/>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.session_url

options.description:
<para>Tag configuration.
</para><para>
Beware that there are quirks that require manual consideration if changing the
values of these files; please see
<link xlink:href="https://github.com/elizagamedev/mujmap/blob/main/mujmap.toml.example"/>
for more details.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags

options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the Trash name attribute. If set to an empty string, this mailbox and its child mailboxes are not synchronized with a tag.
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.deleted

options.description: <para>Directory separator for mapping notmuch tags to maildirs.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.directory_separator

options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the Important name attribute and/or with the $Important keyword. If set to an empty string, this mailbox, its child mailboxes, and these keywords are not synchronized with a tag.
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.important

options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the Inbox name attribute. If set to an empty string, this mailbox and its child mailboxes are not synchronized with a tag.
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.inbox

options.description:
<para>If true, translate all mailboxes to lowercase names when mapping to notmuch
tags.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.lowercase

options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for the IANA $Phishing keyword. If set to an empty string, this keyword is not synchronized with a tag.
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.phishing

options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the Sent name attribute. If set to an empty string, this mailbox and its child mailboxes are not synchronized with a tag.
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.sent

options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the Junk name attribute and/or with the $Junk keyword, except for messages with the $NotJunk keyword. If set to an empty string, this mailbox, its child mailboxes, and these keywords are not synchronized with a tag.
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.spam

options.description:
<para>Username for basic HTTP authentication.
</para><para>
If <literal>null</literal>, defaults to
<xref linkend="opt-accounts.email.accounts._name_.userName"/>.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.username

options.description:
<para>Unique identifier of the account. This is set to the
attribute name of the account configuration.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.name

options.description: <para>Whether to enable NeoMutt.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.enable

options.description: <para>Extra lines to add to the folder hook for this account.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.extraConfig

options.description: <para>List of extra mailboxes</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.extraMailboxes

options.description: <para>Use a different name as mailbox name</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.mailboxName

options.description: <para>Command to send a mail. If not set, neomutt will be in charge of sending mails.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.sendMailCommand

options.description: <para>Whether to enable notmuch indexing.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.enable

options.description: <para>Whether to enable Notmuch support in NeoMutt.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.enable

options.description: <para>List of virtual mailboxes using Notmuch queries</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes

options.description: <para>Restricts number of messages/threads in the result.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes.*.limit

options.description: <para>Name to display</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes.*.name

options.description: <para>Notmuch query</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes.*.query

options.description: <para>Reads all matching messages or whole-threads. The default is 'messages' or nm_query_type.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes.*.type

options.description: <para>Whether to enable OfflineIMAP.</para>
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.enable

options.description: <para>Extra configuration options to add to the account section.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.extraConfig.account

options.description:
<para>Extra configuration options to add to the local account
section.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)
options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.extraConfig.local

options.description:

options.description:
<para>Settings to write to the dconf configuration system.
</para><para>
Note that the database is strongly-typed so you need to use the same types
as described in the GSettings schema. For example, if an option is of type
<literal>uint32</literal> (<literal>u</literal>), you need to wrap the number
using the <literal>lib.hm.gvariant.mkUint32</literal> constructor.
Otherwise, since Nix integers are implicitly coerced to <literal>int32</literal>
(<literal>i</literal>), it would get stored in the database as such, and GSettings
might be confused when loading the setting.
</para><para>
You might want to use <link xlink:href="https://github.com/gvolpe/dconf2nix">dconf2nix</link>
to convert dconf database dumps into compatible Nix expression.</para>
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (GVariant value)
options.title: dconf.settings

options.description: <para>Whether to enable EditorConfig home configuration file.</para>
options.title: editorconfig.enable

options.description:
<para>Some Nix-packages provide debug symbols for
<command>gdb</command> in the <literal>debug</literal>-output.

options.title: home.enableDebugInfo

options.description:
<para>Determines whether to check for release version mismatch between Home
Manager and Nixpkgs. Using mismatched versions is likely to cause errors
and unexpected behavior. It is therefore highly recommended to use a
release of Home Manager than corresponds with your chosen release of
Nixpkgs.
</para><para>
When this option is enabled and a mismatch is detected then a warning
will be printed when the user configuration is being built.</para>
options.title: home.enableNixpkgsReleaseCheck

options.description: <para>The set of packages to appear in the user environment.</para>
options.title: home.packages

options.description:
<para>The activation scripts blocks to run when activating a Home
Manager generation. Any entry here should be idempotent,
meaning running twice or more times produces the same result
as running it once.

</para><para>

If the script block produces any observable side effect, such
as writing or deleting files, then it
<emphasis>must</emphasis> be placed after the special
<literal>writeBoundary</literal> script block. Prior to the
write boundary one can place script blocks that verifies, but
does not modify, the state of the system and exits if an
unexpected state is found. For example, the
<literal>checkLinkTargets</literal> script block checks for
collisions between non-managed files and files defined in
<xref linkend="opt-home.file"/>.

</para><para>

A script block should respect the <varname>DRY_RUN</varname>
variable, if it is set then the actions taken by the script
should be logged to standard out and not actually performed.
The variable <varname>DRY_RUN_CMD</varname> is set to
<command>echo</command> if dry run is enabled.

</para><para>

A script block should also respect the
<varname>VERBOSE</varname> variable, and if set print
information on standard out that may be useful for debugging
any issue that may arise. The variable
<varname>VERBOSE_ARG</varname> is set to
<option>--verbose</option> if verbose output is enabled.</para>
options.title: home.activation

options.description:
<para>List of additional package outputs of the packages
<varname>home.packages</varname> that should be installed into
the user environment.</para>
options.title: home.extraOutputsToInstall

options.description: <para>Attribute set of files to link into the user home.</para>
options.title: home.file

options.description:
<para>Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specific
files to be disabled.</para>
options.title: home.file.<name>.enable

options.description:
<para>Set the execute bit. If <literal>null</literal>, defaults to the mode
of the <varname>source</varname> file or to <literal>false</literal>
for files created through the <varname>text</varname> option.</para>
options.title: home.file.<name>.executable

options.description:
<para>Shell commands to run when file has changed between
generations. The script will be run
<emphasis>after</emphasis> the new files have been linked
into place.
</para><para>
Note, this code is always run when <literal>recursive</literal> is
enabled.</para>
options.title: home.file.<name>.onChange

options.description:
<para>If the file source is a directory, then this option
determines whether the directory should be recursively
linked to the target location. This option has no effect
if the source is a file.
</para><para>
If <literal>false</literal> (the default) then the target
will be a symbolic link to the source directory. If
<literal>true</literal> then the target will be a
directory structure matching the source's but whose leafs
are symbolic links to the files of the source directory.</para>
options.title: home.file.<name>.recursive

options.description:
<para>Path of the source file or directory. If
<xref linkend="opt-home.file._name_.text"/>
is non-null then this option will automatically point to a file
containing that text.</para>
options.title: home.file.<name>.source

options.description: <para>Path to target file relative to <envar>HOME</envar>.</para>
options.title: home.file.<name>.target

options.description:
<para>Text of the file. If this option is null then
<xref linkend="opt-home.file._name_.source"/>
must be set.</para>
options.title: home.file.<name>.text

options.default:
"$HOME"   for state version < 20.09,
undefined for state version ≥ 20.09
options.description: <para>The user's home directory. Must be an absolute path.</para>

options.description:
<para>Cursor configuration. Set to <literal>null</literal> to disable.
</para><para>
Top-level options declared under this submodule are backend independent
options. Options declared under namespaces such as <literal>x11</literal>
are backend specific options. By default, only backend independent cursor
configurations are generated. If you need configurations for specific
backends, you can toggle them via the enable option. For example,
<xref linkend="opt-home.pointerCursor.x11.enable"/>
will enable x11 cursor configurations.</para>
options.title: home.pointerCursor

options.description: <para>Package providing the cursor theme.</para>
options.title: home.pointerCursor.package

options.description:
<para>Whether to enable gtk config generation for <option>home.pointerCursor</option>
.</para>
options.title: home.pointerCursor.gtk.enable

options.description: <para>The cursor name within the package.</para>
options.title: home.pointerCursor.name

options.description: <para>The cursor size.</para>
options.title: home.pointerCursor.size

options.description:
<para>Whether to enable x11 config generation for <option>home.pointerCursor</option>
.</para>
options.title: home.pointerCursor.x11.enable

options.description: <para>The default cursor file to use within the package.</para>
options.title: home.pointerCursor.x11.defaultCursor

options.description: <para>The profile directory where Home Manager generations are installed.</para>
options.title: home.profileDirectory

options.description: Extra directories to add to PATH. These directories are added to the PATH variable in a double-quoted context, so expressions like $HOME are expanded by the shell. However, since expressions like ~ or * are escaped, they will end up in the PATH verbatim.
options.title: home.sessionPath

options.description: Environment variables to always set at login. The values may refer to other environment variables using POSIX.2 style variable references. For example, a variable parameter may be referenced as $parameter or ${parameter}. A default value foo may be given as per ${parameter:-foo} and, similarly, an alternate value bar can be given as per ${parameter:+bar}. Note, these variables may be set in any order so no session variable may have a runtime dependency on another session variable. In particular code like home.sessionVariables = { FOO = "Hello"; BAR = "$FOO World!"; }; may not work as expected. If you need to reference another session variable, then do so inside Nix instead. The above example then becomes home.sessionVariables = { FOO = "Hello"; BAR = "${config.home.sessionVariables.FOO} World!"; };
options.type: lazy attribute set of (string or path or signed integer or floating point number)
options.title: home.sessionVariables

options.description:
<para>An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names
in this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
</para><para>
This option should only be used to manage simple aliases that are
compatible across all shells. If you need to use a shell specific
feature then make sure to use a shell specific option, for example
<xref linkend="opt-programs.bash.shellAliases"/> for Bash.</para>
options.title: home.shellAliases

options.description:
<para>It is occasionally necessary for Home Manager to change
configuration defaults in a way that is incompatible with
stateful data. This could, for example, include switching the
default data format or location of a file.
</para><para>
The <emphasis>state version</emphasis> indicates which default
settings are in effect and will therefore help avoid breaking
program configurations. Switching to a higher state version
typically requires performing some manual steps, such as data
conversion or moving files.</para>
options.title: home.stateVersion

options.default:
"$USER"   for state version < 20.09,
undefined for state version ≥ 20.09
options.description: <para>The user's username.</para>
options.title: home.username

options.description:
<para>Select the enabled input method. Input methods is a software to input
symbols that are not available on standard input devices.
</para><para>
Input methods are specially used to input Chinese, Japanese and Korean
characters.
</para><para>
Currently the following input methods are available in Home Manager:

<variablelist>
<varlistentry>
  <term><literal>fcitx5</literal></term>
  <listitem><para>
    A customizable lightweight input method.
    The next generation of fcitx,
    addons (including engines, dictionaries, skins) can be added using
    <literal>i18n.inputMethod.fcitx5.addons</literal>.
  </para></listitem>
</varlistentry>
<varlistentry>
  <term><literal>nabi</literal></term>
  <listitem><para>
    A Korean input method based on XIM. Nabi doesn't support Qt 5.
  </para></listitem>
</varlistentry>
<varlistentry>
  <term><literal>uim</literal></term>
  <listitem><para>
    The universal input method, is a library with a XIM bridge.
    uim mainly support Chinese, Japanese and Korean.
  </para></listitem>
</varlistentry>
<varlistentry>
  <term><literal>hime</literal></term>
  <listitem><para>An extremely easy-to-use input method framework.</para></listitem>
</varlistentry>
<varlistentry>
  <term><literal>kime</literal></term>
  <listitem><para>A Korean IME.</para></listitem>
</varlistentry>
</variablelist></para>
options.title: i18n.inputMethod.enabled

options.description: <para>Enabled Fcitx5 addons.</para>
options.title: i18n.inputMethod.fcitx5.addons

options.description:
<para>kime configuration. Refer to
<link xlink:href="https://github.com/Riey/kime/blob/develop/docs/CONFIGURATION.md"/>
for details on supported values.</para>
options.title: i18n.inputMethod.kime.config

options.description: <para>Selected UIM toolbar.</para>
options.title: i18n.inputMethod.uim.toolbar

options.description:
<para>Whether to enable Home Manager to define per-user daemons by making use
of launchd's LaunchAgents.</para>
options.title: launchd.enable

options.description: <para>Define LaunchAgents.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents

options.description: <para>Whether to enable ‹name›.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.enable

options.description:
<para>Define a launchd job. See <citerefentry>
<refentrytitle>launchd.plist</refentrytitle><manvolnum>5</manvolnum>
</citerefentry> for details.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config

options.description:
<para>When a job dies, launchd kills any remaining processes with the same process group ID as the job. Setting
this key to true disables that behavior.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.AbandonProcessGroup

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies that launchd should adjust its log mask temporarily to LOG_DEBUG while
dealing with this job.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Debug

options.description:
<para>This optional key is used as a hint to <literal>launchctl(1)</literal> that it should not submit this job to launchd when
loading a job or jobs. The value of this key does NOT reflect the current state of the job on the running
system. If you wish to know whether a job is loaded in launchd, reading this key from a configuration
file yourself is not a sufficient test. You should query launchd for the presence of the job using
the <literal>launchctl(1)</literal> list subcommand or use the ServiceManagement framework's
<literal>SMJobCopyDictionary()</literal> method.

Note that as of Mac OS X v10.6, this key's value in a configuration file conveys a default value, which
is changed with the [-w] option of the <literal>launchctl(1)</literal> load and unload subcommands. These subcommands no
longer modify the configuration file, so the value displayed in the configuration file is not necessarily
the value that <literal>launchctl(1)</literal> will apply. See <literal>launchctl(1)</literal> for more information.

Please also be mindful that you should only use this key if the provided on-demand and KeepAlive criteria
are insufficient to describe the conditions under which your job needs to run. The cost to have a
job loaded in launchd is negligible, so there is no harm in loading a job which only runs once or very
rarely.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Disabled

options.description: <para>This flag causes launchd to use the <literal>glob(3)</literal> mechanism to update the program arguments before invocation.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnableGlobbing

options.description:
<para>This flag instructs launchd that the job promises to use <literal>vproc_transaction_begin(3)</literal> and
<literal>vproc_transaction_end(3)</literal> to track outstanding transactions that need to be reconciled before the
process can safely terminate. If no outstanding transactions are in progress, then launchd is free to
send the SIGKILL signal.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnableTransactions

options.description:
<para>This optional key is used to specify additional environment variables to be set before running the
job.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnvironmentVariables

options.description:
<para>The amount of time launchd waits before sending a SIGKILL signal. The default value is 20 seconds. The
value zero is interpreted as infinity.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ExitTimeOut

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies the group to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd is
running as root. If UserName is set and GroupName is not, the the group will be set to the default
group of the user.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.GroupName

options.description:
<para>Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with <literal>setrlimit(2)</literal>.  The following
keys apply:</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits

options.description: <para>The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.CPU

options.description: <para>The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Core

options.description:
<para>The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program may
extend its break with the <literal>sbrk(2)</literal> system call.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Data

options.description: <para>The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.FileSize

options.description: <para>The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the <literal>mlock(2)</literal> function.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.MemoryLock

options.description:
<para>The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemon
will set the <literal>sysctl(3)</literal> kern.maxfiles (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxfilesperproc (HardResourceLimits)
value in addition to the <literal>setrlimit(2)</literal> values.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles

options.description:
<para>The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a system
wide daemon will set the <literal>sysctl(3)</literal> kern.maxproc (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxprocperuid
(HardResourceLimits) value in addition to the <literal>setrlimit(2)</literal> values.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses

options.description:
<para>The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process's resident set size may grow.  This imposes a
limit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the system
will prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize

options.description:
<para>The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program's
stack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Stack

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies whether <literal>initgroups(3)</literal> should be called before running the job.  The default
is true in 10.5 and false in 10.4. This key will be ignored if the UserName key is not set.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.InitGroups

options.description:
<para>This optional key is used to control whether your job is to be kept continuously running or to let
demand and conditions control the invocation. The default is false and therefore only demand will start
the job. The value may be set to true to unconditionally keep the job alive. Alternatively, a dictionary
of conditions may be specified to selectively control whether launchd keeps a job alive or not. If
multiple keys are provided, launchd ORs them, thus providing maximum flexibility to the job to refine
the logic and stall if necessary. If launchd finds no reason to restart the job, it falls back on
demand based invocation.  Jobs that exit quickly and frequently when configured to be kept alive will
be throttled to converve system resources.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.KeepAlive

options.description: <para>This required key uniquely identifies the job to launchd.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Label

options.description:
<para>Specifies higher-level event types to be used as launch-on-demand event
sources.  Each sub-dictionary defines events for a particular event
subsystem, such as "com.apple.iokit.matching", which can be used to
launch jobs based on the appearance of nodes in the IORegistry. Each
dictionary within the sub-dictionary specifies an event descriptor that
is specified to each event subsystem. With this key, the job promises to
use the xpc_set_event_stream_handler(3) API to consume events. See
xpc_events(3) for more details on event sources.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LaunchEvents

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies whether the job can only be run once and only once.  In other words, if the
job cannot be safely respawned without a full machine reboot, then set this key to be true.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LaunchOnlyOnce

options.description:
<para>This configuration file only applies to hosts NOT listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.hostname
in <literal>sysctl.conf(5)</literal> for this feature to work reliably.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadFromHosts

options.description:
<para>This configuration file only applies to the hosts listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.hostname
in <literal>sysctl.conf(5)</literal> for this feature to work reliably.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadToHosts

options.description:
<para>This configuration file only applies to sessions of the type specified. This key is used in concert
with the -S flag to <command>launchctl</command>.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadToSessionType

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies whether the kernel should consider this daemon to be low priority when
doing file system I/O.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LowPriorityIO

options.description:
<para>This optional key is used to specify Mach services to be registered with the Mach bootstrap sub-system.
Each key in this dictionary should be the name of service to be advertised. The value of the key must
be a boolean and set to true.  Alternatively, a dictionary can be used instead of a simple true value.

Finally, for the job itself, the values will be replaced with Mach ports at the time of check-in with
launchd.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices

options.description:
<para>Reserve the name in the namespace, but cause bootstrap_look_up() to fail until the job has
checked in with launchd.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices.HideUntilCheckIn

options.description:
<para>If this boolean is false, the port is recycled, thus leaving clients to remain oblivious to the
demand nature of job. If the value is set to true, clients receive port death notifications when
the job lets go of the receive right. The port will be recreated atomically with respect to bootstrap_look_up()
calls, so that clients can trust that after receiving a port death notification,
the new port will have already been recreated. Setting the value to true should be done with
care. Not all clients may be able to handle this behavior. The default value is false.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices.ResetAtClose

options.description: <para>This optional key specifies what nice(3) value should be applied to the daemon.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Nice

options.description:
<para>This key was used in Mac OS X 10.4 to control whether a job was kept alive or not. The default was
true.  This key has been deprecated and replaced in Mac OS X 10.5 and later with the more powerful
KeepAlive option.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.OnDemand

options.description:
<para>This optional key describes, at a high level, the intended purpose of the job.  The system will apply
resource limits based on what kind of job it is. If left unspecified, the system will apply light
resource limits to the job, throttling its CPU usage and I/O bandwidth. The following are valid values:

   Background
   Background jobs are generally processes that do work that was not directly requested by the user.
   The resource limits applied to Background jobs are intended to prevent them from disrupting the
   user experience.

   Standard
   Standard jobs are equivalent to no ProcessType being set.

   Adaptive
   Adaptive jobs move between the Background and Interactive classifications based on activity over
   XPC connections. See <literal>xpc_transaction_begin(3)</literal> for details.

   Interactive
   Interactive jobs run with the same resource limitations as apps, that is to say, none. Interactive
   jobs are critical to maintaining a responsive user experience, and this key should only be
   used if an app's ability to be responsive depends on it, and cannot be made Adaptive.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ProcessType

options.description:
<para>This key maps to the first argument of <literal>execvp(3)</literal>.  If this key is missing, then the first element of
the array of strings provided to the ProgramArguments will be used instead.  This key is required in
the absence of the ProgramArguments key.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Program

options.description:
<para>This key maps to the second argument of <literal>execvp(3)</literal>.  This key is required in the absence of the Program
key. Please note: many people are confused by this key. Please read <literal>execvp(3)</literal> very carefully!</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ProgramArguments

options.description:
<para>Much like the WatchPaths option, this key will watch the paths for modifications. The difference being
that the job will only be started if the path is a directory and the directory is not empty.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.QueueDirectories

options.description: <para>This optional key is used to specify a directory to <literal>chroot(2)</literal> to before running the job.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.RootDirectory

options.description:
<para>This optional key is used to control whether your job is launched once at the time the job is loaded.
The default is false.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.RunAtLoad

options.description:
<para>This optional key is used to specify launch on demand sockets that can be used to let launchd know when
to run the job. The job must check-in to get a copy of the file descriptors using APIs outlined in
launch(3).  The keys of the top level Sockets dictionary can be anything. They are meant for the application
developer to use to differentiate which descriptors correspond to which application level protocols
(e.g. http vs. ftp vs. DNS...).  At check-in time, the value of each Sockets dictionary key will
be an array of descriptors. Daemon/Agent writers should consider all descriptors of a given key to be
to be effectively equivalent, even though each file descriptor likely represents a different networking
protocol which conforms to the criteria specified in the job configuration file.

The parameters below are used as inputs to call <literal>getaddrinfo(3)</literal>.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets

options.description:
<para>This optional key can be used to request that the service be registered with the
<literal>mDNSResponder(8)</literal>.  If the value is boolean, the service name is inferred from the SockServiceName.</para>
options.type: null or boolean or list of string
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.Bonjour

options.description:
<para>This optional key can be used to request that the datagram socket join a multicast group.  If the
value is a hostname, then <literal>getaddrinfo(3)</literal> will be used to join the correct multicast address for a
given socket family.  If an explicit IPv4 or IPv6 address is given, it is required that the SockFamily
family also be set, otherwise the results are undefined.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.MulticastGroup

options.description:
<para>This optional key is a variant of SockPathName. Instead of binding to a known path, a securely
generated socket is created and the path is assigned to the environment variable that is inherited
by all jobs spawned by launchd.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SecureSocketWithKey

options.description: <para>This optional key can be used to specifically request that "IPv4" or "IPv6" socket(s) be created.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockFamily

options.description: <para>This optional key specifies the node to <literal>connect(2)</literal> or <literal>bind(2)</literal> to.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockNodeName

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies whether <literal>listen(2)</literal> or <literal>connect(2)</literal> should be called on the created file
descriptor. The default is true ("to listen").</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPassive

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies the mode of the socket. Known bug: Property lists don't support
octal, so please convert the value to decimal.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPathMode

options.description:
<para>This optional key implies SockFamily is set to "Unix". It specifies the path to <literal>connect(2)</literal> or
<literal>bind(2)</literal> to.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPathName

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies the protocol to be passed to <literal>socket(2)</literal>.  The only value understood by
this key at the moment is "TCP".</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockProtocol

options.description: <para>This optional key specifies the service on the node to <literal>connect(2)</literal> or <literal>bind(2)</literal> to.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockServiceName

options.description:
<para>This optional key tells launchctl what type of socket to create. The default is "stream" and
other valid values for this key are "dgram" and "seqpacket" respectively.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockType

options.description:
<para>Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with <literal>setrlimit(2)</literal>.  The following
keys apply:</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits

options.description: <para>The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.CPU

options.description: <para>The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Core

options.description:
<para>The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program may
extend its break with the <literal>sbrk(2)</literal> system call.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Data

options.description: <para>The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.FileSize

options.description: <para>The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the mlock(2) function.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.MemoryLock

options.description:
<para>The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemon
will set the <literal>sysctl(3)</literal> kern.maxfiles (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxfilesperproc (HardResourceLimits)
value in addition to the <literal>setrlimit(2)</literal> values.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles

options.description:
<para>The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a system
wide daemon will set the <literal>sysctl(3)</literal> kern.maxproc (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxprocperuid
(HardResourceLimits) value in addition to the <literal>setrlimit(2)</literal> values.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses

options.description:
<para>The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process's resident set size may grow.  This imposes a
limit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the system
will prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize

options.description:
<para>The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program's
stack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Stack

options.description: <para>This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stderr when using <literal>stdio(3)</literal>.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardErrorPath

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being supplied to stdin when using
<literal>stdio(3)</literal>.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardInPath

options.description: <para>This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stdout when using <literal>stdio(3)</literal>.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardOutPath

options.description:
<para>This optional key causes the job to be started every calendar interval as specified. Missing arguments
are considered to be wildcard. The semantics are much like <literal>crontab(5)</literal>.  Unlike cron which skips job
invocations when the computer is asleep, launchd will start the job the next time the computer wakes
up.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer is woken, those events will be coalesced into
one event upon wake from sleep.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval

options.description: <para>The day on which this job will be run.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Day

options.description: <para>The hour on which this job will be run.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Hour

options.description: <para>The minute on which this job will be run.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Minute

options.description: <para>The month on which this job will be run.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Month

options.description: <para>The weekday on which this job will be run (0 and 7 are Sunday).</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Weekday

options.description:
<para>This optional key causes the job to be started every N seconds.  If the system is asleep, the job will
be started the next time the computer wakes up.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer is
woken, those events will be coalesced into one event upon wake from sleep.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartInterval

options.description: <para>This optional key causes the job to be started every time a filesystem is mounted.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartOnMount

options.description:
<para>This key lets one override the default throttling policy imposed on jobs by launchd.  The value is in
seconds, and by default, jobs will not be spawned more than once every 10 seconds.  The principle
behind this is that jobs should linger around just in case they are needed again in the near future.
This not only reduces the latency of responses, but it encourages developers to amortize the cost of
program invocation.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ThrottleInterval

options.description:
<para>The recommended idle time out (in seconds) to pass to the job. If no value is specified, a default time
out will be supplied by launchd for use by the job at check in time.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.TimeOut

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies what value should be passed to <literal>umask(2)</literal> before running the job. Known bug:
Property lists don't support octal, so please convert the value to decimal.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Umask

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies the user to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd is
running as root.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.UserName

options.description:
<para>This optional key specifies that launchd should instruct the kernel to have the job wait for a debugger
to attach before any code in the job is executed.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WaitForDebugger

options.description: <para>This optional key causes the job to be started if any one of the listed paths are modified.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WatchPaths

options.description: <para>This optional key is used to specify a directory to <literal>chdir(2)</literal> to before running the job.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WorkingDirectory

options.description: <para>The presence of this key specifies that the daemon expects to be run as if it were launched from inetd.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.inetdCompatibility

options.description:
<para>This flag corresponds to the "wait" or "nowait" option of inetd. If true, then the listening
socket is passed via the standard in/out/error file descriptors. If false, then <literal>accept(2)</literal> is
called on behalf of the job, and the result is passed via the standard in/out/error descriptors.</para>
options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.inetdCompatibility.Wait

options.description:
<para>This option allows modules to define helper functions,
constants, etc.</para>
options.title: lib

options.description:
<para>Whether to install the HTML manual. This also installs the
<command>home-manager-help</command> tool, which opens a local
copy of the Home Manager manual in the system web browser.</para>
options.title: manual.html.enable

options.description:
<para>Whether to install a JSON formatted list of all Home Manager
options. This can be located at
<filename><profile directory>/share/doc/home-manager/options.json</filename>,
and may be used for navigating definitions, auto-completing,
and other miscellaneous tasks.</para>
options.title: manual.json.enable

options.description:
<para>Whether to install the configuration manual page. The manual can
be reached by <command>man home-configuration.nix</command>.
</para><para>
When looking at the manual page pretend that all references to
NixOS stuff are actually references to Home Manager stuff.
Thanks!</para>
options.title: manual.manpages.enable

options.description:
<para>How unread and relevant news should be presented when
running <command>home-manager build</command> and
<command>home-manager switch</command>.

</para><para>

The options are

<variablelist>
<varlistentry>
  <term><literal>silent</literal></term>
  <listitem>
    <para>
      Do not print anything during build or switch. The
      <command>home-manager news</command> command still
      works for viewing the entries.
    </para>
  </listitem>
</varlistentry>
<varlistentry>
  <term><literal>notify</literal></term>
  <listitem>
    <para>
      The number of unread and relevant news entries will be
      printed to standard output. The <command>home-manager
      news</command> command can later be used to view the
      entries.
    </para>
  </listitem>
</varlistentry>
<varlistentry>
  <term><literal>show</literal></term>
  <listitem>
    <para>
      A pager showing unread news entries is opened.
    </para>
  </listitem>
</varlistentry>
</variablelist></para>
options.title: news.display

options.description: <para>The Nix package that the configuration should be generated for.</para>
options.title: nix.package

options.description:
<para>If enabled (the default), checks for data type mismatches and that Nix
can parse the generated nix.conf.</para>
options.title: nix.checkConfig

options.description: <para>Additional text appended to <filename>nix.conf</filename>.</para>
options.title: nix.extraOptions

options.description: <para>User level flake registry.</para>
options.title: nix.registry

options.description:
<para>Whether the <option>from</option> reference needs to match exactly. If set,
a <option>from</option> reference like <literal>nixpkgs</literal> does not
match with a reference like <literal>nixpkgs/nixos-20.03</literal>.</para>
options.title: nix.registry.<name>.exact

options.description: <para>The flake input to which <option>from></option> is to be rewritten.</para>
options.title: nix.registry.<name>.flake

options.description: <para>The flake reference to be rewritten.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or package)
options.title: nix.registry.<name>.from

options.description: <para>The flake reference to which <option>from></option> is to be rewritten.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or package)
options.title: nix.registry.<name>.to

options.description:
<para>Configuration for Nix, see
<link xlink:href="https://nixos.org/manual/nix/stable/#sec-conf-file"/> or
<citerefentry>
  <refentrytitle>nix.conf</refentrytitle>
  <manvolnum>5</manvolnum>
</citerefentry> for available options.
The value declared here will be translated directly to the key-value pairs Nix expects.
</para>
<para>
Configuration specified in <option>nix.extraOptions</option> which will be appended
verbatim to the resulting config file.</para>
options.type: attribute set of (Nix config atom (null, bool, int, float, str, path or package) or list of (Nix config atom (null, bool, int, float, str, path or package)))
options.title: nix.settings

options.description:
<para>The configuration of the Nix Packages collection. (For
details, see the Nixpkgs documentation.) It allows you to set
package configuration options.

</para><para>

If <literal>null</literal>, then configuration is taken from
the fallback location, for example,
<filename>~/.config/nixpkgs/config.nix</filename>.

</para><para>

Note, this option will not apply outside your Home Manager
configuration like when installing manually through
<command>nix-env</command>. If you want to apply it both
inside and outside Home Manager you can put it in a separate
file and include something like

<programlisting language="nix">
  nixpkgs.config = import ./nixpkgs-config.nix;
  xdg.configFile."nixpkgs/config.nix".source = ./nixpkgs-config.nix;
</programlisting>

in your Home Manager configuration.</para>
options.title: nixpkgs.config

options.description:
<para>List of overlays to use with the Nix Packages collection. (For
details, see the Nixpkgs documentation.) It allows you to
override packages globally. This is a function that takes as
an argument the <emphasis>original</emphasis> Nixpkgs. The
first argument should be used for finding dependencies, and
the second should be used for overriding recipes.

</para><para>

If <literal>null</literal>, then the overlays are taken from
the fallback location, for example,
<filename>~/.config/nixpkgs/overlays</filename>.

</para><para>

Like <varname>nixpkgs.config</varname> this option only
applies within the Home Manager configuration. See
<varname>nixpkgs.config</varname> for a suggested setup that
works both internally and externally.</para>
options.title: nixpkgs.overlays

options.description:
<para>Environment variables that will be set for the PAM session.
The variable values must be as described in
<citerefentry>
  <refentrytitle>pam_env.conf</refentrytitle>
  <manvolnum>5</manvolnum>
</citerefentry>.
</para><para>
Note, this option will become deprecated in the future and its use is
therefore discouraged.</para>
options.title: pam.sessionVariables

options.description:
<para>List of authorized YubiKey token IDs. Refer to
<link xlink:href="https://developers.yubico.com/yubico-pam"/>
for details on how to obtain the token ID of a YubiKey.</para>
options.title: pam.yubico.authorizedYubiKeys.ids

options.description:
<para>File path to write the authorized YubiKeys,
relative to <envar>HOME</envar>.</para>
options.title: pam.yubico.authorizedYubiKeys.path

options.description: <para>Whether to enable Abook.</para>
options.title: programs.abook.enable

options.description:
<para>Extra lines added to <filename>$HOME/.config/abook/abookrc</filename>.
Available configuration options are described in the abook repository:
<link xlink:href="https://sourceforge.net/p/abook/git/ci/master/tree/sample.abookrc" />.</para>
options.example:
''
  field pager = Pager
  view CONTACT = name, email
  set autosave=true
''
options.title: programs.abook.extraConfig

options.description: <para>Whether to enable aerc.</para>
options.title: programs.aerc.enable

options.description:
<para>Extra lines added to <filename>$HOME/.config/aerc/accounts.conf</filename>.
See aerc-config(5).</para>
options.type: strings concatenated with "\n" or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string of float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)
options.title: programs.aerc.extraAccounts

options.description:
<para>Extra lines added to <filename>$HOME/.config/aerc/binds.conf</filename>.
Global keybindings can be set in the `global` section.
See aerc-config(5).</para>
options.type: strings concatenated with "\n" or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string of float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)
options.title: programs.aerc.extraBinds

options.description:
<para>Extra lines added to <filename>$HOME/.config/aerc/aerc.conf</filename>.
See aerc-config(5).</para>
options.type: strings concatenated with "\n" or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string of float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)
options.title: programs.aerc.extraConfig

options.description:
<para>Stylesets added to <filename>$HOME/.config/aerc/stylesets/</filename>.
See aerc-stylesets(7).</para>
options.type: attribute set of ((attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string of float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)) or strings concatenated with "\n")
options.title: programs.aerc.stylesets

options.description:
<para>Templates added to <filename>$HOME/.config/aerc/templates/</filename>.
See aerc-templates(7).</para>
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with "\n"
options.title: programs.aerc.templates

options.description: <para>Whether to enable the afew initial tagging script for Notmuch.</para>
options.title: programs.afew.enable

options.description:
<para>Extra lines added to afew configuration file. Available
configuration options are described in the afew manual:
<link xlink:href="https://afew.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration.html" />.</para>
options.example:
''
  [SpamFilter]
  
  [Filter.0]
  query = from:pointyheaded@boss.com
  tags = -new;+boss
  message = Message from above
  
  [InboxFilter]
''
options.title: programs.afew.extraConfig

options.description: <para>Whether to enable Alacritty.</para>
options.title: programs.alacritty.enable

options.description: <para>The Alacritty package to install.</para>
options.title: programs.alacritty.package

options.description:
<para>Configuration written to
<filename>$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/alacritty/alacritty.yml</filename>. See
<link xlink:href="https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty.yml"/>
for the default configuration.</para>
options.title: programs.alacritty.settings

options.description:
<para>Whether to enable the Alot mail user agent. Alot uses the

Either configure by pixels or a scaling factor. When using pixel method the
<citerefentry>
  <refentrytitle>xrandr</refentrytitle>
  <manvolnum>1</manvolnum>
</citerefentry>
option
<parameter class="command">--scale-from</parameter>
will be used; when using factor method the option
<parameter class="command">--scale</parameter>
will be used.
</para><para>
This option is a shortcut version of the transform option and they are mutually
exclusive.</para>

options.description:
<para>Whether to enable Bash completion for all interactive Bash shells.

</para><para>

Note, if you use NixOS or nix-darwin and do not have Bash completion
enabled in the system configuration, then make sure to add

<programlisting language="nix">
  environment.pathsToLink = [ "/share/bash-completion" ];
</programlisting>

to your system configuration to get completion for system packages.
Note, the legacy <filename>/etc/bash_completion.d</filename> path is
not supported by Home Manager.</para>
options.title: programs.bash.enableCompletion

options.title: programs.broot.settings.modal

options.description:
<para>Color configuration.
</para><para>
Complete list of keys (expected to change before the v1 of broot):

<itemizedlist>
  <listitem><para><literal>char_match</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>code</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>directory</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>exe</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>file</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>file_error</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>flag_label</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>flag_value</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>input</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>link</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>permissions</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>selected_line</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>size_bar_full</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>size_bar_void</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>size_text</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>spinner</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>status_error</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>status_normal</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>table_border</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>tree</literal></para></listitem>
  <listitem><para><literal>unlisted</literal></para></listitem>
</itemizedlist></para>

<para>
Add <literal>_fg</literal> for a foreground color and
<literal>_bg</literal> for a background colors.</para>
options.title: programs.broot.settings.skin

options.description:
<para>Define new verbs. For more information, see
<link xlink:href="https://dystroy.org/broot/documentation/configuration/#verb-definition-attributes"/>.
</para><para>
The possible attributes are:
</para>

<para>
<variablelist>
  <varlistentry>
    <term><literal>invocation</literal> (optional)</term>
    <listitem><para>how the verb is called by the user, with placeholders for arguments</para></listitem>
  </varlistentry>
  <varlistentry>
    <term><literal>execution</literal> (mandatory)</term>
    <listitem><para>how the verb is executed</para></listitem>
  </varlistentry>
  <varlistentry>
    <term><literal>key</literal> (optional)</term>
    <listitem><para>a keyboard key triggering execution</para></listitem>
  </varlistentry>
  <varlistentry>
    <term><literal>shortcut</literal> (optional)</term>
    <listitem><para>an alternate way to call the verb (without
    the arguments part)</para></listitem>
  </varlistentry>
  <varlistentry>
    <term><literal>leave_broot</literal> (optional)</term>
    <listitem><para>whether to quit broot on execution
    (default: <literal>true</literal>)</para></listitem>
  </varlistentry>
  <varlistentry>
    <term><literal>from_shell</literal> (optional)</term>
    <listitem><para>whether the verb must be executed from the
    parent shell (default:
    <literal>false</literal>)</para></listitem>
  </varlistentry>
</variablelist></para>
options.type: list of attribute set of (boolean or string)
options.title: programs.broot.settings.verbs

options.description:
<para>List of Firefox add-on packages to install for this profile.
Some pre-packaged add-ons are accessible from NUR,
<link xlink:href="https://github.com/nix-community/NUR"/>.
Once you have NUR installed run

<screen language="console">
  <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>nix-env -f '<nixpkgs>' -qaP -A nur.repos.rycee.firefox-addons</userinput>
</screen>

to list the available Firefox add-ons.

</para><para>

Note that it is necessary to manually enable these extensions
inside Firefox after the first installation.</para>
